p: Here, we investigated whether arbovirus genetic variation may alter transmission kinetics in epidemiologically significant ways. Specifically, we experimentally measured variation in transmission kinetics among several wild-type isolates of dengue virus (DENV) type 1 representing the worldwide genetic diversity of recently circulating strains. DENV are positive-sense, single-stranded RNA viruses in the Flavivirus genus that cause more human infections than any other arbovirus [ 13]. They exist as four genetically divergent types that loosely cluster antigenically [ 14]. Each DENV type is divided into major phylogenetic clades, often termed genotypes, which in turn contain a wide diversity of strains [ 15]. All four serotypes of DENV are mainly transmitted by the mosquito Aedes aegypti worldwide [ 16].
